intro: Erigeron ramosus var. discoideus, commonly known as the silky fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has a branched stem covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its foliage is usually grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and it blooms from late summer into early fall.
